title: Chapter 109
body:
Chapter 109


Guess we have to admit that, it seemed pretty amazing when the pop-ups were full of words such as “Unpleasant Night Rain Rhythm, The Sword Set The World Alight”. Nothing much, it just had this indescribable burning passion within!


The literary work, “The Strongest King” had a very big influence, mainly due to “Yu Shengfan’s” appearance, as this character had been created in a beautiful way. Besides the main character, the following character who gave another deep impression was none other than Yu Shengfan herself.


Readers who have read it would felt that she did give out a very deep impression.


Yu Shengfan’s terrifying reflexes was way beyond the limits of any ordinary person. Only she had the ability to control her character while mocking her opponent at the same time. Too bad “LoL” was different compared to “Eternal War”, as words displayed on the public chat could be hidden. This had actually made Yu Shengfan’s “Chat Flow” to become useless, as she could not show off her spectacular chat bubbles in “LoL”. At most, she could only make her champion “dance” to taunt her opponent


Every single word of “Yu Shengfan’s Vicious Quotes”, made her sense of presence went way off the chart, on the other hand Rosemary’s reputation increased because of it. Readers thought that he fully demonstrated his writing skills on Yu Shengfan’s venomous phrases, what a language master he was. Perhaps because of those venomous phrases were not considered as a vulgar language, but a form of language arts.


“Miss Purple”, the lady streamer had never read “The Strongest King”, so the words appeared in the pop-ups made her confused, but that did not stop her from becoming a fan of “F*cking Demon King” because his earlier performances were simply awesome!


Especially Yasuo the Unforgiven, those reflexes, and elegance, were simply indescribable with words. She even had the misconception that the player had become one with Yasuo, and that was why he was able to use that champion skillfully


As the witness of this solo match, “Miss Purple” announced the final winner “F*cking Demon King”, and asked “Jungling King” to pay his wages.


She then took the initiative to add “F*cking Demon King” as her friend in the meantime. All she wanted was to get along with this High God, so that he could bring up her rankings


Meanwhile, the player controlling “Jungling King” had swapped back into Feng Ming. His best friend, Cao Jinglong had this “completely lost” facial expression and not to mention, his mentality was completely shattered as well!


Zed, the master of shadows was his strongest champion, yet he got beaten up so badly that he began to doubt his life. His opponent still teased him right from the start till the end of the match! All those dreams of becoming a professional player had suddenly turned into something unachievable!


Cao Jinglong knew that his opponent had a substitute player, or even a professional player. His initial thoughts regarding professional players were none other than gaining certain standards, so that he could eventually become a professional mid lane player within a famous team. But after being defeated by “F*cking Demon King”, he had this sudden thought that gaming was meaningless. That’s right, with the existence of this freak, where were all the meanings of playing games?


Gaming was all about winning, but when Cao Jinglong faced his opponent, in despair, he realized he could not win no matter what!


Besides, his opponent was able to show off his extreme skills, while leisuring around typing and taunting him, in fact, this very much indicated that his opponent did not show his true powers!


So, is there any meaning left in gaming!?


Feng Ming did not have that 1,000 QQ coins, so he quitted the game without much consideration. He did not have the courage to ridicule his opponent either, simply because he was unable to pay, and had to call “F*cking Demon King” daddy.


Feng Ming had no guts to even look at the broadcasting room. By now, he knew he would be criticized by those pop-ups crazily. Even though he was badly criticized, he was not going to fulfill his promise to pay that 1,000 QQ coins, which was equivalent to 1,000 RMB. He would not even hand in his own money if his best friend’s car had overturned.


“Ah Long, your opponent is really that strong? I feel like you were totally overwhelmed in last two rounds” Said Feng Ming. He was not going to blame Cao Jinglong since he had always relied on him.


“Yeah, he’s way too strong, can’t you see he could type and taunt at the same time? What does this even imply? It means that his skills are much better than mine, I can sense that he was full of confidence, and even felt his aura of not losing to anyone in a solo match. I was totally overwhelmed in terms of strength and power”


While Cao Jinglong mentioned it, he recalled the words, “Three Dimensional Yu Shengfan”, “Unpleasant Night Rain Rhythm, The Sword Set the World Alight” in the pop-ups from the broadcasting room. He could not help but to look up those terms in Baidu, and found a novel, “The Strongest King”. He began reading it out of curiosity, and could not control himself later on!


The novel was great and the character Yu Shengfan was interesting! Wait, so… the substitute player for “F*cking Demon King” was “Yu Shengfan”? He would gladly accept it if he was ever defeated by Yu Shengfan in reality, as she was a super gaming genius, even the main protagonist Lin Feng was envious of her insane gaming talents


No!


There was no way in reality that a bug[1] player like Yu Shengfan would have existed, obviously the opponent was just imitating her!


Cao Jinglong snapped out of it, and realized that reading novels were way more interesting than gaming. Hmm.. might as well write a novel of his own, so that he could imagine himself as an invincible person, and not the one who was being defeated in the gaming realm


The showdown was put to an end.


Zhao Hao sat in front of his computer again, and rejected the friend request of that internet famous lady streamer that admired him. If it was not because of her encouragement, he would not be in that situation. Fortunately for him, he had a secret weapon, and was saved by his super High God little sister, or else he would end up in an embarrassing situation.


That’s right, to Zhao Hao, 1,000 RMB was nothing! All he cared was his reputation. Whoever messed him up would get a taste of their own medicine.


Of course, whoever made his reputation increased, he would be pleased with that person. In fact, he was already pleased with Zhao Youyue, but for now, he could only think of his little cousin as an amazing person! He did not expect her to be an expert in “LoL”, even though she did mention that she only knew a little of it earlier on


Maybe this was the attitude of a real High God, truly a modest one.


“Youyue Meimei, you played so well just like Yu Shengfan from ‘The Strongest King’, are you interested in playing professional?” Zhao Hao asked in a serious way.


“Lin Feng was not in your team, what’s the point of playing professionally?” Zhao Youyue deactivated her “Yu Shengfan” mode right after she gave her reply.


“Look at that broken team of yours, just give it a break! Xiao Youyue has just entered high school not long ago, for her, learning is more important, don’t ruin her studies, you useless brother!” Zhang Wanjun added from the side.


Zhao Hao smiled awkwardly, and never mentioned it again. He just thought that, “Even when you are skilled in gaming, you could only make it this far, that’s it.” This little sister of his was now part of the Zhao’s family, a real noble person.


Then, the three of them left the cyber cafe and went on for movies, but the internet was full of the name “F*cking Demon King” due to his spectacular solo matches.


Translation Note:


1. Bug – It used to describe a cheater or overpowered character in gaming term.
